summary: Savvy customers may seek the lowest prices when choosing to have their neighbor’s kid mow their lawn, but may think twice when selecting a surgeon. DOD faces a similar choice—it may use the "lowest price technically acceptable" process and pay less or use a "trade-off" process and possibly pay more if additional benefits outweigh the higher cost. title: Defense Contracting: DOD's Use of Lowest Price Technically Acceptable Source Selection Procedures to Acquire Selected Services
